- [Gerry] So how long do you think you can last?

- Contract faculty are suffering in Ontario, but I hear good things about the situation in Quebec, which has the highest precarious faculty pay in Canada.
- [Gerry] Some have suggested that contracts in Quebec might be better than some of the ones in other parts of Canada.
- Well, I mean there are two things. I think in some aspects because we've been unionized within ourselves.
Only contract faculty with contract faculty.
I am a contract faculty. I represent these: about 12 to 13,000 members at FNEEQ, everywhere in Quebec.
So we've got an expertise over almost 50 years of negotiating and bettering our working conditions.
We have made gains.
And so we gave ourselves a platform that every three years, and I'm trying to, not to go too detailed there, but every three years, all of the presidents of these different unions of course lecturers, we meet and we discuss, "Okay, over the next three years
what will be our main targets?"
And we established a small plan of battle over three years with a budget, with publicity, with visibility.
